instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .

threads.title: SOLVED: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.17A after liquid damage. Short on PP*_SLPDDR & Heat signature on T2
threads.message:
Hi Guys, this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came with liquid damage on 2 spots only:

<CAPACITOR>C6466</CAPACITOR>/6452 - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SPKRPAML</SIGNAL> - 12.6V - 0.39
<CAPACITOR>C9580</CAPACITOR> - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL> - 12.6V - 0.39

The only short I located apart from than CPU Phase lines is on
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SLPDDR</SIGNAL> - 0.049
<SIGNAL>PP0V82_SLPDDR</SIGNAL> - 0.032
<SIGNAL>PPVDCPU_AWAKE</SIGNAL> - 0.010

There is a heat signature on T2 when power is applied where the current goes 0.01A - 0.17A - 0.01A

[ATTACH]60640[/ATTACH][ATTACH]60641[/ATTACH][ATTACH]60642[/ATTACH]

threads.title: SOLVED: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.17A after liquid damage. Short on PP*_SLPDDR & Heat signature on T2
threads.message:
There are the readings I got from good board:
L7806-09   018
L7811/12   047
L7816/17   105
Is normal to have differences with other board, but 049 looks to low, comparing with 105.

Check diode mode at L9520/80 too.

threads.title: SOLVED: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.17A after liquid damage. Short on PP*_SLPDDR & Heat signature on T2
SOLVED: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.17A after liquid damage. Short on PP*_SLPDDR & Heat signature on T2
threads.message:
Do you get all SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages?
Also check SSD and G3S voltages.

threads.title: SOLVED: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.17A after liquid damage. Short on PP*_SLPDDR & Heat signature on T2
threads.message:
SLPS2R - 0.8, 1.1, 1.8present
<SIGNAL>PPVDDCPU_AWAKE</SIGNAL> - 0.5V - is it low?
PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE - 0.8V
AWAKE -1.2,  1.8, 3.3

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL> - 12V
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> - 2.5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL> - 3.3v

threads.title: SOLVED: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.17A after liquid damage. Short on PP*_SLPDDR & Heat signature on T2
SOLVED: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.17A after liquid damage. Short on PP*_SLPDDR & Heat signature on T2
threads.message:
Thank [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]  this resolved it. Not sure how liquid damage is related to DFu corruption. :/
The minute I start pushing into DFU mode and the meter connected to the top left port, it starts pulling above 2A and charging the battery.
Fallowed this - [URL]https://iboysoft.com/wiki/dfu-mode-mac.html[/URL] and did Restore from this - [URL]https://support.apple.com/en-au/guide/apple-configurator-mac/apdebea5be51/mac[/URL]

Wiped the data but that's fine. Now I need to replace the keyboard. 

Has anyone tried[URL='https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005003506664778.html'] these screws[/URL] for keyboard replacement on new macs? [URL='https://www.aliexpress.com/item/4000322162707.html']These ones I have[/URL] are a bit long and the keyboard profile sags.
